When the discouraging reports of the colporteurs had reached a climax, she would urge that notwithstanding all these difficulties, the workers must have faith that success would attend their labors. Repeatedly she assured the disheartened colporteurs that it had been shown her that books could be sold in Europe in such a way as to give 


                                                       37 

support to the workers, and bring to the publishing house sufficient returns to enable it to produce more books.--LS 281-285.
